Reviews.Title: Inexpensive not cheap
Reviews.Author: NeverBend
Reviews.Content: My main family TV is a Samsung 55" plasma that died twice within 10 months of purchase (Samsung repaired it under warranty).  Great picture but we hold our breath every time the screen does anything out of the ordinary.  The TV is less than 2 years old.I've been looking for a 46"-50" basic LED TV in the Black Friday sales to give to my wife for Christmas that could also serve as a (temporary) replacement when the Samsung's dies (as I suspect it will).I had never heard of oCosmo but it seemed like a perfect fit with features beyond the basics that I'd have settled for including USB, QAM tuner and Roku ready.  For less than $400 tax paid, shipped to my door with a 5 year extended warranty I bought it despite no user reviews (at that time).It was ordered on Monday and received on Wednesday.  No HDMI cable was included (do any sets include them?).  The power cable is attached to the set (and protected in foam for shipping). Normally I'd wait before posting a review but there's little history or feedback on the oCosmo brand so I do so with the understanding that my comments are made after only about 8 hours of use.Packaging:  TV arrived well packed with foam and self-stick cellophane protecting the screen.  The oCosmo wasn't deficient in packaging and the set arrived in good order.Install:  Followed the Quick Install instructions and had the set running in a couple of minutes.  All ports are clearly defined (better than my Samsung) and have easy access.  Front panel push button controls are accessible, work and don't feel balky.Setup:  I used the remote to run through the setup.  The granularity of picture/audio control is acceptable for me but less than the Samsung and perhaps not as refined as some would like.  I did find that I had to press several times to access some of the menu items (perhaps the supplied AAA batteries were weak?).Picture:  The picture, out of the box and without adjustment, is good.  I compared the oCosmo to my Samsung (Plasma) with the same shows and movies and the Samsung is a little sharper (on faces but not patterns) and has better color balance.  How much of the difference is Plasma to LED or that I've tuned the Samsung I can't say but the oCosmo picture taken by itself is good or better and it's superior to most similar sized TVs that I recently saw at a big box store.  Whites are bright, blacks are dark and colors have good saturation.Audio:  Sound quality was like most unaided sets that I've heard.  I set the bass to 8 and treble to 3 and this added richness and distinction to the sound.  At 6'-8' and a volume setting of 20 or more the sound volume was acceptable.  There's little gain in volume past a setting of 30, in other words, a setting of 90 sounded like it should have been 40.  If you want it loud or the movie experience you'll need to add that capability.Initial impression:  Since the oCosmo 47" TV is primarily a Christmas gift for my wife it's already a success since she loves it.  She has no complaints whatsoever.  I'm more critical about picture quality (as noted above) but as a potential backup to the frail Samsung the oCosmo would be perfectly acceptable for as long as we would need to use it and I like the feature set that seems to have been selected for practical need and not gimmick (like the rarely used 3D on the Samsung).Nothing that I've seen, from packaging to manuals, build quality or performance makes me think of a cheap product.  I'd call it inexpensive and at a total cost of less than $400 (including the extended warranty) the oCosmo has the look of a winner.

Reviews.Title: No Frills TV with Great Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: 2busy
Reviews.Content: Quite frankly, I don't know how they're able to sell something like this for so cheap ($329). So far the TV is excellent. It requires setting the colors to one's own preferences or leaving it in one of the preset modes to get the desired look. Once it's set, it rivals many of the brand names. The speakers are a bit underpowered. However, for this price, we're considering an external set in any event. No frills TV with great picture quality; excellent bargain.It's a recent purchase so will add more details after some time spent watching various programs over the coming weeks.---Update 12/7/13---We've had this TV for several days now and continue to be impressed with its performance - especially hooked up to a set of external speakers. As another reviewer mentioned regarding the 40" version of this TV, the Sony RMVZ220 universal remote control works on this 47" TV as well - using the out-of-the-box preset factory settings on the remote. The instructions that come with the remote describe the button functions. A programmable remote would probably be better however to capture buttons for some options and Roku functions.Also, as others have mentioned, the TV comes with a coupon and code which offers $20 off (as of 12/12) a Roku streaming stick from Roku's website.

Reviews.Title: Very good value
Reviews.Author: H.R. Namata "H.R. Namata"
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a Christmas present for my mom. This is a great value for the price. The hardware/software is not comparable to the $1000+ LEDs but when it is below $330 it is easier to accept a few of the shortcomings.Pros:PriceGood picture quality3 HDMI including one MHL portCons:The picture quality is not as sharp as my old Samsung DLP; some small image details are washed outNo optical outI used my THX television calibration app and here are my settings. I hope you enjoy:Brightness 50Contrast 62Color 46Tint 13Sharpness 25Full size 100%WarmAll advanced off

Reviews.Title: An OK set given the low cost
Reviews.Author: Schwartz
Reviews.Content: There was only one review up when I ordered this TV. Based on the reviews of the 40" oCosmo set I took a chance and ordered one. This set appears to be the same as a Sceptre E475BV-FMDU. The manuals, menus, bodies, etc., all look the same. I wanted another TV to have around in the basement for connecting my last gen consoles to. I wasn't expecting much for the price but figured it'd be OK to play around on.I knew there would be compromises made and here is what I have noticed:-The remote feels cheap and a couple times while gripping it and pressing the buttons I have popped the battery door open. They do give you batteries branded “LT Super Lusty” (LOL) for the remote.-The picture also looks a bit grainy when compared to my other sets. It doesn’t seem to be related to the sharpness control. Maybe it is the dot pitch of the screen but I am not sure what causes it.-The overall picture is not bad once you play around with it. I turned all the extra picture processing features off.-There is backlight bleed and flash lighting from the sides and corners that is noticeable in dark scenes but I expected this with a cheap set. This set is bright. There is no backlight adjustment that I have found. It seems to be permanently set at full brightness. If you are using this TV in a bedroom at night it is pretty bad because of the extreme brightness. In a bigger room or well lit room it isn't as much of a problem. Usually you can temper the backlight bleed by lowering the backlight brightness on a set but you don't have that option here. I wonder if a firmware update could enable backlight adjustment because in the specifications part of the manual it says Lamp Adjust: Yes.-The set doesn’t seem to support HDMI CEC control and I didn’t see mention of it in the manual. It doesn’t respond to my receiver or Sony Google TV box like my other sets.-The sound isn’t anything great and I didn’t expect it to be. I use external speakers with all my sets.-You get a tempered glass stand that I am meh about. I hope it doesn’t decide to shatter one day and drop the set on its face. They do give you a screwdriver and screws to attach it with though.I haven’t done a lot of gaming on it yet because I wanted to get this review up to help holiday shoppers but I will report back if I have any problems that I notice gaming. The manual says the screen is rated at 8ms but the oCosmo website says 6ms. I don’t know which is right.After getting the set and playing with it for a bit I think it is a pretty nice TV for the $329 that I got it for. My whole opinion of this set is based around its price. There is no way I would have accepted this set at a higher price but for what it cost it is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised!
Reviews.Author: Melvin Hines
Reviews.Content: I bought the oCosmo TV not knowing anything about the brand. This obviously concerned me, but I figured it must be some Black Friday deal. It turns out that oCosmo is (1) a new company formed just this year (2013), and (2) somehow related to the bargain brand Sceptre.Finding all of this out made me understandably skeptical, especially after I received a defective TV in poor packaging when I ordered my 46" Black Friday Westinghouse TV. When I first received the oCosmo TV, the first thing I noticed was the weight. This was MUCH heavier than the Westinghouse, which concerned me some. Upon opening, I noticed why however. From what I can tell so far, everything about this TV has been very high quality. The stand (compared to the plastic Westinghouse stand) is what appears to be a steel construction. That stand, the TV, and everything else in the box was carefully packaged. Even the tool oCosmo sent to have the TV screwed into the stand was a high-quality screw driver! Once you would buy from a store. Once I put the TV on the stand, I was also pleasantly surprised to find out that it is a swivel stand as well. Then, I turned on the TV. The visual quality was excellent! Now, I had a 42" Sony flat screen that lasted me nearly 10 years, and in comparison the sound of the Sony TV was much better. But the visual quality of this TV is breathtaking! I think I'm going to like this new oCosmo brand...

Reviews.Title: Nice, Big, cheap  Sound just ok
Reviews.Author: Paul Bradford
Reviews.Content: oCosmo.... "what company is that, you may ask?"  I'd compare it to RCA or Sceptre (go look up their 47").  I installed it this morning and have the kids checking it out.  My first impressions are it's not the TV you buy to impress everyone on the block with BOOMING SOUND and CRYSTAL CLEAR viewing.  It's the TV you get to upgrade cheaply from 32" to 47" and accept it for it's weaknesses.Likes:It's BIGIt has 3 HDMI (1 of which is a MHL - Mobile High-def Link)Bright screenBatteries for remote are made by Lusty (not sure if that's a like or dislike)Dislikes:Remote is el cheapo feeling.  Already have spent to long trying to change sources.  Hopefully universal remote knows oCosmoSound is tinny... gives you that retro 19" retro tube TV feel.So if you only want to spend $350 and don't care to much about sound quality (maybe you're running to a Sound System anyway) then this is an OK purchase.  Another good use of this might be as a REALLY BIG monitor.

Reviews.Title: Whether money is an issue or not, this is an AWESOME HDTV.
Reviews.Author: BBorrelli
Reviews.Content: Just received this TV in the mail last night.  I opened it up and noted the quality of the packaging and included materials (including a small screwdriver for attaching the tempered glass swivel base)!I'm not going to lie—purchasing an off-brand TV with hardly any reviews, I was extremely scared.  This is the first TV I've ever bought (being a hard-working full-time commuting college student and part-time employee) and I've never had enough money laying around to buy a big Sony or Samsung!REVIEW:At 47" and full 1080p, the picture is incredible.  I'm used to the picture of my parents 55" high-end Samsung, and, while I admit the picture is better on that one, honestly, there's not much complaining to be done about this one. I've seen so many reviews of lower-end TVs with "bad frame rate" (at 60Hz or 120Hz)—I played Battlefield 4 for way too long last night (regrettably) and the frame rate is SMOOTH AS ANYTHING.Basically, what you're getting here is a main competition HDTV for the price of something that should be a washed out, disposable plastic box.PICTURE ADJUSTMENT:As I've found, is that, by default, the blacks are black and the whites are white—HOWEVER, the dark greys are also black and the light colors are white too.  This can be fixed by turning off the dynamic contrast (and honestly, I think it looks much better and more natural this way anyway.)  The only other slight gripe I have is that the "normal" color profile is a bit too warm and the "warm," of course, is exceptionally yellowy-orange.  The "cool" setting is closer to natural white, but (obviously) reduces a bit of the red spectrum unfortunately.AUDIO & INPUTS:It's fine. Seriously, a lot of TVs come with little tin can speakers...and these are better than average.  Let's face it though, people—you're not buying speakers, you're buying an HDTV.  Most TV manufacturers today assume you'll be purchasing a soundbar and subwoofer and give the consumer a couple of cheap, whispery little speakers.I connected the Samsung soundbar my parents gave me for Christmas a couple years back.  Obviously, coupled with the sound, this thing looks and feels like a main-brand Samsung, Sharp...LG...etc.The connectors in the back are plentiful, color-coded and well-organized.  The built-in tuner works GREAT.  I watched several channels in FULL HD, like CBS and ION.  The picture quality there is awesome.- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - -  I'm actually really excited to watch movies on this thing.  For around $400 with a full 5-year warranty...you can't beat this.The build quality is high. The picture quality is great.  The attention to detail and quality by oCosmo in general is fantastic.  While the screen's viewing angle might not be as expansive as a Sammy's or as great in the dynamic contrast area, there's no doubt that this is a steal.I have a feeling oCosmo is taking losses on these things to establish their name as a quality TV manufacturer.  Incredible.

Reviews.Title: great budget 1080p display
Reviews.Author: J. Merritt
Reviews.Content: Took a chance and ordered this when there were no reviews.  Showed up today and I'm writing this using my computer hooked up to it. Have only watched a few shows on netflix and tried out a game.  Really impressed for the price.  Will update if I have any issues.  The sound hasn't been bad, as reviews on the smaller sizes lead me to expect, although it does seem to project more sound behind the TV than in front, which because of our weird use location we notice.  A lot of range on the swivel.  The energy star sticker picture on this item page as of writing ($19) does not match the one that came on the TV ($15), not complaining.Also there was no picture of the positioning of the connectors: they're all on the back with the 3x hmdi + spdi + vga + coax + usb facing down and the stereo audio out + headphone out + component + composite face the viewers left.  The power cable is not removable.Hard not to be impressed moving from an old 32" 720p lcd, if you're on the fence I say go for it, and put the money you save towards retirement ;)

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV even at a higher price
Reviews.Author: Howard
Reviews.Content: I replaced an LG TV with this one. I was a little hesitant because of the exceptionally reasonable price and the unknown name. It arrived this evening and the set up was pretty easy, even the FIOS remote, program it like a Sony??. The picture is very good out of the box but changing the video settings made it better. Some say the audio is not great, but I think it is better than the LG after set up changes. We have a sound bar and that was no problem to connect. All in all a 47 in TV, 5 year warranty and free delivery (Prime)  for less that $400 is a great deal.  Only been an hour but the first impression is very good my wife and I are very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Wow.
Reviews.Author: T. Klosterman
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am not a TV connoisseur : 60hz, 120hz, response times, deep blacks, whatever.  I've watched Netflix and some movies on a 32 inch off brand TV for years.  I decided to take a risk on an extremely cheap 47 inch TV because Amazon backed it and was looking for an upgrade.  I received the TV today and have been watching an action HD movie and some Netflix shows and frankly have been blown away.  It looks...amazing.  This behemoth TV cost me less than my original 32 inch TV and my 18inch flat screen monitor I bought in college.I'm posting this now since I bought it without any reviews.  From what I can tell so far, this is a new "Vizio" brand; cheap because its unknown.  Assuming catastrophe doesn't occur in the next few weeks, I'm really impressed with this product.  Given its price point, I'd be hard to not recommend it to anyone.  Is it as good as a Samsung or LG? I doubt it, but it more than meets my basic requirements.  I almost feel like they made a mistake about its price.  Cheers.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase for price, terrible remote
Reviews.Author: Kaps
Reviews.Content: I found this TV to be very great. I initially bought the Seiki 46" for the same price on Black Friday. Unfortunately when i openend it there was an issue with the Television (looked like it got dropped and had a fat black line of dead pixels accross it. Since returning it, I bought this tv) which I am pleased with.1. The look of the tv is stunning. It is very slim, much slimmer than the Seiki and has a very cool look for the price. it reminded me of an LG TV in terms of looks and finish. The stand was tempered glass and also looked very modern for the prize.2. The TV itself looks very good. This is a TV that I use in my room and bought it for its size at the cost of what is normally <40" tv. That  being said, the tv picture quality is grainy, this might be because it is such a big size, and since it is only in my room; I am MUCH closer to the TV than in most cases. In times I am able to view low quality pictures. The settings dont seem to change too much with the tv, but overall it is a very good look for the price. Unfortunately there is no way to change backlight settings; at times I wish it was brighter, and at night lower.3. The tv has 3 HDMI, and 1 USB, the two most important things to me. The USB is not a service port, and thus is fully functional. I have yet to test if it can play .mkv files but will do so soon hopefully. This was great for me, as it actually is able to hide a chromecast fully and keep the visible wires down to one for me (power).4. The remote is quite possibly the worst I have used. This is where my one star reduction comes from. Many times it takes multiple pushes of a button for the tv to register it and changing the settings at the beginning was abysmal. If the remote worked properly this would be great.All in all this was a great purchase for the price. Much better than all other TV's that are in remotely the same price range\.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional value if you want a big TV
Reviews.Author: Chris Moore
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV when there were no reviews, knowing that it was most likely a rebrand of Sceptre. I took a chance because I don't need a lot from my TV, and I knew Amazon would take it back if it was really bad. I have actually been VERY impressed with this television for this price.The TV is packaged exceptionally well, especially considering this price point. UPS/FedEx would have to almost intentionally try to smash this thing for it not to arrive in good shape. Set-up was very easy. The base gets screwed on to the TV with five screws. I was going to the garage to get a screwdriver when my wife informed me that it came with one. The TV actually came with a half-way decent screwdriver! I've never seen that. The build quality if fairly good. Not as good as the high-end "name" brands like Samsung or Vizio, but just as good as their lower-end offerings.We have an over-the-air antenna and a Roku. The digital tuner is really sensitive. I've had very little luck getting the local CBS station on the Vizio that we own, but it comes in clear on this TV with exactly the same antenna set-up. The on-screen set-up menus are a little clunky, but they are pretty self explanatory. You don't have a ton of control over the picture and sound, but you really don't need it, unless you are an extreme picture/sound person, in which case, you wouldn't be buying this TV.The picture is fantastic out of the box, but everyone likes to tweak to fit their preferences, and you have that ability. I don't know that much about these things, which is probably why I'm 100% satisfied with what I see. Someone else might try to compare this to a higher-end TV and find differences in picture. I cannot. If you are like me, then save hundreds of dollars and get this TV. If you need 240 Hz refresh, know what response rate means, etc. then maybe spend about twice for the same size. Watching football in HD, I actually can see the difference between 60 Hz and 120-240 Hz, but it isn't a $300+ difference for me. Your mileage might vary.The sound out of the factory speakers is pretty much terrible. I have never owned a TV with decent sound. I have never seen a TV in the store with built in sound quality that I find acceptable. Therefore, I already have a soundbar. I have actually turned the speakers on the TV off and use my soundbar exclusively. This is pretty easy to do in the menu. With the speakers on, if I set the EQ to the preset "Rock" setting, I get really bad vibration from the speakers when they go above about 15-20. I didn't have this problem with any other setting, or when I just disabled the EQ. Don't know what that is about, but if the internal speaker system is something you are interested in, then be careful. If you have an external speaker system, then don't worry.The remote is really cheap and requires you to mash down pretty hard. I also couldn't control my older Roku with it as it suggested. I'm sure a new streaming stick would work fine, but I haven't tested this capability. I use a universal remote, anyway, so a crappy remote wouldn't be a deal killer for me. Panasonic makes a great one that can learn commands from any remote for about $15. Using that remote, I programed my universal to Sony codes (as stated in the manual), and then swapped the volume and mute buttons to run my sound bar. Happy as can be. One remote for the TV, sound bar, DVD player, and Roku.In summary, for $330 this TV cannot be beat. I rate it 5 stars at this price. If this TV was $650 like the TVs I was looking at before taking the plunge on this one, then I would rate it 4 stars. I would be ok with this TV at twice the cost. I'm ecstatic about it at $330. For $330 for the TV, $60 for a Roku streaming stick, $100 for a decent vizio sound bar, $15 for a universal remote, and $30 for a 4-year extended warranty, you have an exceptional smart TV set-up for about $530 that you can feel confident about for the next 4-5 years or more. I can't even find another TV this size alone for that price.Time will tell if it holds up. Spend the extra $20-30 for the extended warranty if that worries you. The warranty I bought covers in-home technical service on this size TV, so you wouldn't even need to worry about shipping it back if you have a problem 3 years down the road. I usually skip these warranties, but considering no one has ever heard of an oCosmo, and the thing was already so darn cheap, I went ahead and bought it. If the TV falls apart one day after my warranty coverage, then it will still have been worth the price and if oCosmo is still a thing at that point, then I would buy another. (Of course, in 5 years we'll probably all be beaming content directly into our heads, or something.)

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Eoff
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about purchasing this TV considering the low price, but it works great!  I'm sure videophiles will nitpick the color, contrast, refresh, etc.  The average person will think this is an excellent TV!  It was also packed very well--thick styrofoam on all sides.  Hard-core home theater enthusiasts can pay double for perfect picture quality, but the rest of us will enjoy saving the extra dough.

Reviews.Title: Pros and cons, very good value, but don't expect too much
Reviews.Author: Easton Hamblin
Reviews.Content: I would give it a worse score, but based on value, its four stars.Pros: Picture looks great. Mounts well on our wall. Very thin and light, but does not seem to lack quality compared to other nicer Toshiba or Samsung models.Cons: Remote is cheapy, you have to aim right at the sensor. The sound on this is not good. It works for regular viewing, but to have any enjoyable experience, don't expect the sound to do anything for you.I got this on sale on Black Friday weekend, $339, and we are very happy with our purchase for the money we spent on a 47" TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Joseph Marrero
Reviews.Content: At first I was worried about the performance of the brand, I have never heard of it or seen a friend who has had one but then again I remember when people were saying "what's Vizio?" My guess is this manufacturer will not be an "off brand" for long. After 3 long days of gaming/ watching movies this set has run like a champ, no flicker, great picture, I'm very pleased and feel I got exactly what I had expected from this purchase!

Reviews.Title: I think I got a Lemon, hoping for a good replacement!
Reviews.Author: Kelly B. "Kellybelle"
Reviews.Content: I received this TV very quickly from Amazon. When I set up TV, there was no sound on any of the options (DVD, Headphones, or Cable). Somehow when I turned it on in the morning the cable sound was working, but when I went to see if DVD and headphones were working, they were not. I then proceeded to check the Wii, this had sound, but the color was fuzzy and black and white?!?! I called Ocosmo and tech told me to exchange it since I just bought it rather than even troubleshooting and trying to solve issues. I called Amazon and they were great as always and promptly sent return label and replacement TV. I have not received the replacement yet, but I am hoping there are no issues because the picture does look great and the sound is decent on the cable once I got it to work. High hopes for this great deal, I hope it lives up, I will update once I receive the replacement.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a fabulous price
Reviews.Author: SmartiMarti
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my daughter so her hubby wouldn't find out about it - but it was her gift to him for his b-day. She was a little worried about a no-name set, but price was a major consideration. You can't get much bigger for the price. The picture is very good and the sound is good but not great compared to major brands (the only reason it didn't get 5 stars). It doesn't have as many inputs as some of the higher-priced models but is sufficient for the average user and he is good to go with gaming. Looks nice. Arrived on time, well packed and no damage. Absolutely no complaints and either of us would definitely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great Bargain, Great Delivery
Reviews.Author: W. T. Towles
Reviews.Content: I received my oCosmo 47” HDTV yesterday via UPS, 3 days after ordering (including 22 hours sitting in one UPS facility). The remarkable Amazon price for this TV on CyberMonday and a few days following with free shipping has now increased by $150.I bought the oCosmo to replace my previous “big” TV (32”), which is now moved to my office. Handling the 32” is child’s play compared with the 47” (it weighs 42 lbs. with its very heavy base). As an old guy working alone with a bad back, I had to plan every move—getting it out of the carton, attaching the base, placing the table it sits on, and moving it into place—so as not to drop or bump it or end up on the floor myself with back spasms. The shipping carton was in perfect condition as was the TV. Everything worked out, and, once I followed the instructions correctly, got my Dish Network remote to recognize the TV and control the power, volume, and mute functions.The oCosmo remote is big and complex looking but was easy to figure out for making adjustments to the picture and sound and setting the date and time. Lots of other functions are controlled from the remote, including managing an oCosmo sound bar. (I never expect much from built-in TV speakers so am using a low end set of external Logitech speakers that work just fine from the TV’s headphone port.)Overall, I definitely feel that this is a 5 star product based on less than one day of experience. And even at the new, higher price, I think it’s still a bargain. Just one complaint—many important cable connections—including HDMI—to and from the TV face downward from the back of the set, not outward (there are also some on the left side). So if you are putting the set on a low table as I am, you must connect cables before setting the TV in place. If you need to make another connection later, you will need a mirror.Cheers to Amazon and oCosmo!

Reviews.Title: Amazing 47' TV on a budget!
Reviews.Author: Y. Du
Reviews.Content: I just received this TV today. As a student on a budget, this was a great deal (time of purchase: $329). I will attempt to review this product from an average-tech-Joe's perspective, as I have never had a TV bigger than 21', nor a sound-system of any sort.On arrival, the product is well packaged. Within, you get: the 47' TV, a glass stand (fairly sturdy), a remote w/ batteries, 5 screws, a screwdriver, and the TV manual. It was easy to assemble, and everything was set up within 10 minutes. The remote is somewhat cheap, but it was functional so I really have no complaints.I have basic cable with no HD channels; not-surprisingly, I was not impressed with how it looked. But when I connected my PS3 to it (via HDMI), I was absolutely blown away! The picture quality was clear and beautiful, and the sound quality was crisp. I live in an apartment, so I really don't notice the softness of the TV's audio that other reviewers described. Games (Farcry 3 and GTA V) and blu-ray movies (Avatar and Dark Knight) looked fantastic with no signal-delay. I also did not notice any ghosting. Lastly, I connected my computer to it (via HDMI). Netflix and internet browsing (youtube and ESPN online) looked great as well, with no noticeable image delays.Along with the TV, I also purchased a 3 year protection plan for 15 bucks. Very happy with the quality of this TV. If you guys have any questions, please ask and I will try my best to answer them.

Reviews.Title: WORK'S/LOOK'S GREAT!!!!
Reviews.Author: Destoney
Reviews.Content: I will start off to say for quick readers The television is Very Well worth it and Looks GREAT!!!!!When i received my television i got everything hooked up fine. I turned the massive LED TV on forthe first time. The screen was the blue setup screen. First thing i noticed, My remote did not work.So i thought batteries where bad. Found out later remote was DOA. Back to the TV.In Settings there is an option for BLACK or BLUE screen when there is no input/nothing connected.I chose to turn it black. I instantly noticed color change ( Greenish White smokie ) look in one of the corners about6 inches long. For some reason i tried convincing myself it was because it was a 300 dollar Television. How goodcould it get..... So i played games watched movies on the TV and all the colors looked great. But as soon as a blackpicture would come in. It looked like a sunrise in the top corner along with a few other blotches. so i called amazon andthey told me a replacement will be there 2 day shipping and free shipping back on the bad one. I poked the top of the screen where it was bad and the screen was loose. I was disappointed and thought i should have paid 300 extra for a good TV. Anyway I sent the one back and received my new TV. Opened it very Carefully, put the bottom stand on.. Put batteries in remote. Felt the corners everything was tight !!!! YES. Then i waited for the TV to warm up. -21 Degree's here. Turned it on. changed the screen to black to see if there was any fading. ----------------TURNED OUT FLAWLESS Picture was great ! Remote worked good :) Blacks where all Black in the corners. Color pops out ! Great sound for a TV. I do not regret this purchase at all. I did a little review of my Bad TV so other people can check when they receive theirs. Overall I'm very happy with the TV and amazon Took care of me like usual. Assuming Other people will get a Good one and i just got a lemon. the Television works Great For An Amazing price. I would choose this over paying 600+ For the same thing different brand.

Reviews.Title: Good picture, terrible sound quality.
Reviews.Author: T. Fredericks "ladybug618"
Reviews.Content: It's not bad, we have plugged it into an external speaker and are happy with it as a second TV, the sound is not great, but I knew that from other reviews, so I am mostly satisfied.

Reviews.Title: sound
Reviews.Author: edgar
Reviews.Content: works and looks great!sound sucks but thats what sound bars and systems are for.over all awesome tv for the price!

Reviews.Title: oCOSMO 47" TV
Reviews.Author: D. WADE "Biker-join us"
Reviews.Content: This tv is great. The size, price, and picture are just amazing. Actually, for what I paid, the picture- after adjusting it a bit is really nice. Everything works fine. No problems setting it up. Amazon is the greatest. The first tv was damaged in shipping. The hole inbox was a dead giveaway. Trouble free return/replacement.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Lois
Reviews.Content: My husband was skeptical when I showed him this TV (to be a gift for my daughter & son-in-law for Christmas), because oCOSMO is so new to the market,  but the price was so reasonable and Amazon's return policy so great, I decided to chance it.  the picture is wonderful! People have complained about the sound quality, but I see the same complaints listed for virtually all of the flat screens! So far, I have no regrets about the purchase and the kids LOVE it!

Reviews.Title: Not perfect, but a fantastic buy for the price
Reviews.Author: Chad
Reviews.Content: The TVs design is sleek and the picture quality is top-notch. I only have two complaints:1. The remote control that ships with the set is terrible and the TV does not seem responsive to it at all.2. The speakers leave a lot to be desired, but are manageable.Despite those things I am extremely happy with my purchase. I got it on Cyber Monday 2013 for $330. I can't knock a 46" TV with fantastic picture for that price. Excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Exchanged for another one!
Reviews.Author: gottabehappyk
Reviews.Content: I received my first Ocosmo three days ago and it sucked!!  Picture was blurry and remote barely worked even with my own batteries.  Exchanged rather than returned in hopes of receiving one that everyone has been raving over ---- I GOT IT!!  Picture is clear.  Hooked it up to my Bose with a little help from Bose and I am utterly surprised.  I just hope it continues to work as well as it does now, 3 years from now.  Wow!!!  Crisp and clean.  Only four stars for not having a fiber optic connection for the sound.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, mediocre sound, no ARC HDMI or Optical Cable connections for soundbars
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Scott
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV, and the fact that I bought just a few days ago for $329 makes it even nicer.  I found the picture to be crystal clean with no modification necessary.  The sound is just OK, and if you want to hook up a sound bar other than oCOSMO make sure not to get one that requires an optical or ARC HDMI connection because this TV has neither.  I just bought a nice SONY HTCT260H Sound Bar with Wireless Subwoofer only to find out that the TV didn't have what it took to make it work so I had to return it.Another feature that could have been improved was the HDMI outlets.  They are under the lip in the back of the unit so you're basically working blind trying to get those darned cables in there.Finally, it's no slim bezel television.  It's fat and heavy, but as I said, for the $329.00 investment I won't complain.  The TV has a great picture, but mediocre sound.  The remote is functional and well laid out, although you sometimes have to press the buttons more than once to get a response from the TV.  All in all I can recommend this TV, but not if you have to pay more than $500.00.

Reviews.Title: Good tv for price
Reviews.Author: TJT1962
Reviews.Content: I received my tv this morning after a big hassel with UPS (that's a different review :( ). I carried the tv in and had it set up and watching in less than 30 min. The picture and sound are both just OK, as another reviewer commented the picture seems a little grainy. The 6 year old 28" Sony Bravia has a sharper picture, but for $329.00 I'm satisfied with this tv. I wouldn't give $500.00 for it.

Reviews.Title: So far very very happy No Complaints!!!
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: Great price and Great purchase. Ordered on Tuesday and got it on Thursday with an additional shipping fee. It arrived well packed everything included. Very easy set up took about 10 minutes. Didn't really need to make any adjustments, picture perfect right out of the box and ready to go. Very pleased with this purchase but lets see how long it last.P.S. Gonna get that Roku thing real soon too.

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV , awesome picture
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: Great LED TV.  One of my first tests was to hook up PS3 and check out the graphics on one of my favorite colorful video games, Ni No Kuni.  It looks amazing on this TV.  Very little adjustments were needed, I just brought up the brightness level from 50 to 60 and now it looks fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at the right price
Reviews.Author: Girder
Reviews.Content: I can't vouch for it's performance with blu ray, and this is certainly not a smart TV, but if you can get this for the right price this a great lower end TV with a very good picture. Huge upgrade to my old ten year old none-LED TV (and at just about more than a third the price)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: jacob clemons
Reviews.Content: It's a wonderful screen, no problems and i've had it for 6 months. honestly so much more worth the money than a big expensive name brand tv.

Reviews.Title: Bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: For the price, you're getting excellent picture quality, and just about every connection out there EXCEPT Optical. I use this TV for cable broadcast, PS3 gaming, and as a secondary monitor for my PC. It's done everything I've wanted it to w/o any issues. The TV's speakers produce decent sound quality, but I recommend using a sound bar (personal pref.)

Reviews.Title: Great value.
Reviews.Author: Roarin1
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this TV. I mostly use it for watching movies and playing video games on my XBox 360, and the picture is always excellent. My one criticism might be that the speakers could have a bit more oomph. When the neighbors are getting particularly loud above my apartment or the air conditioner kicks on, it can be difficult to hear until I turn the volume almost all the way up. Otherwise it's really easy to assemble the stand and to set up the TV. Picture quality is great and I have no complaints that a set of surround sound speakers can't fix.

Reviews.Title: Great TV period!
Reviews.Author: Roy L. Reed III
Reviews.Content: I own a Vizio and a Sanyo. Now an Ocosmo. This TV was purchased in Nov. 2013 for my wife and kids mainly because she is a stay at home mom and she wanted a bigger TV in the bedroom. I don't think this TV has been shut off yet and it has a great picture! The only thing would be the sound quality. Not bad for a bedroom but I would buy a sound bar or other system if it were in the living room. Overall you can't beat the picture and price! Very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Gerald
Reviews.Content: Relative to the price, I think it's great. But I'm not one to care too much about specs, either. I know the sound can be spotty at times. Picture quality is solid, and overall the TV gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Nice Monitor
Reviews.Author: Michael G Garvey
Reviews.Content: I HAVE ENJOYED MY 47 inch tv.  Great picture.  The remote has never worked.Dog is chewing on it.  I caught it for 329, so how can I complain.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Brad Fisher
Reviews.Content: I'm not overly picky when it comes to TV's.  This fits my needs perfectly.  No quality problems and clear picture.  Due to other reviews about sound, I purchased the matching sound bar at the same time.  However, the TV speakers do work ok for regular TV just fine.  I do turn the sound bar on for games and movies, but that's just becouse I already have it.

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: A. Hirsh "Animal lover"
Reviews.Content: Excellent television at such an affordable price! Quality is up to par. Best gift I gave my husband. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: Kristen Piering
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend. He wanted a good quality, big TV but I couldn't afford the big name brands. I decided to give oCOSMO a try and hope for the best. We were so happy with the results! The TV came well packaged (although hard to hide in the weeks before Christmas, haha). It came right out of the box and was super quick and easy to set up the stand. We may wall-mount it, but have not yet. But the pivot stand that it comes with is great. We had it up and running in just a few minutes. The picture quality is GREAT -- have had no issues or complaints at all. The design is sleek and classy and looks great in our bedroom. I would definitely recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: This TV is very new as far as the company. I like the picture, very sharp and clear. I like how the TV pivots on the stand.I would recommend this product and the company.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: MelCB
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price, good picture quality. My only complaint is the sound isn't great, but at this low price, just buy some speakers if you're picky about sound

Reviews.Title: long wait review
Reviews.Author: brandon
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a while now and the sound issue aside this has been an awesome TV. Word to future buyers get a set of triple A batteries the ones it comes with are rather weak.

Reviews.Title: Better Than Expected
Reviews.Author: RickeeLeeTee
Reviews.Content: My wife was very skeptical when I told her that I bought this HDTV at the advertised price from Amazon Warehouse.  The HDTV arrived in a timely manner and was well packaged.  She made the comment about saving the packaging to return the HDTV because she was sure I would be disappointed with my purchase.  I unpacked it and hooked it up (very easy to do) and turned it on.  She was surprised with the bright clear picture and the ease of operation.  I was pleased with the quality of my purchase and consider this was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Very good deal
Reviews.Author: Kaelar
Reviews.Content: Really great picture, packaging was excellent, sound is not very good but that's expected since flat screen tv makers assume you'll be buying a sound bar or subwoofer and speakers so they focus more on video quality. Hooked mine to a $25 subwoofer and mini speaker set I got at Ross Dress for Less which sounds amazingly better than it might seems. Very happy with purchase as yet.

Reviews.Title: Bought for Christmas
Reviews.Author: Jon Young
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for a present to myself for Christmas. I was using a 27'' Tube TV from 2000, so needless-to-say this was a HUGE upgrade. Honestly, it was. This TV is awesome! It's very thin for the price, and the picture quality is outstanding! The viewing angles are great, and the TV even has a 20 degree swivel on the X- Axis, to really improve your experience. Definitely a great buy, it isn't the best TV on the market, but darn it, it tries.

Reviews.Title: awesome for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jesse Garcia
Reviews.Content: The video quality was quite good for this price range.  The overall unit works well. This only thing is the base sound it just ok. But once hooked up to a sound system it along with the great picture it rocks for the price range.

Reviews.Title: 4.5 stars
Reviews.Author: Conure fan
Reviews.Content: I see how it can be easy to rate this as 5 stars, because if you bought this during cyber week like I did, you got a great price on it.  But it isn't perfect, so the best I can do is 4.5 stars rather than 5.  It would be nice if it had an optical jack, but it doesn't.  And the sound isn't that good, so there's a bit of a false economy with the low price when you have to spend more to get speakers to make it decent.  I knew that going into it, so I'm not surprised.  Just keep it in mind in terms of value.  During the holiday season I got a great deal on a soundbar and subwoofer combo so even when you consider paying for that, it was a good purchase that I don't regret.  And if you already have a theater system, no extra expense for you.Some people complain that the picture isn't great - I'm upgrading from a 27 inch SD TV so it seems great to me!Overall, a close to great TV at a great price who's value was somewhat diminished by the sound.  If you can get this for around 300 dollars - great.  If you would have to spend close to 400 or more, I'd only recommend it if you had speakers already.

Reviews.Title: Good Quality TV
Reviews.Author: B. Salhus
Reviews.Content: Everything works great.  I have bought cheap TVs in the past and this one works better than the others.  The remote works good and the sound is really good.  The picture is awesome!  I would not hesitate buying an oCosmo again.

Reviews.Title: Steal of a deal.
Reviews.Author: Frank Contreras
Reviews.Content: Great tv and for the price ($329 I bought it before xmas) you just can't beat it. Great picture... sounds nothing to brag about but i didnt expect it to be. Those who dock it on sound come really. Pick yourself up a DECENT SOUNDBAR! and you got yourself an awesome package, Bought this for my Dad for Christmas and he loves it. I have highend LG tvs in my home and this thing impressed me.

Reviews.Title: where is my extended warranty?
Reviews.Author: James Deanna
Reviews.Content: Tv works good but i put the extended warranty on it when purchesed and never got any info on it! Where is my warranty?

Reviews.Title: decent TV (and here's how to fix the remote)
Reviews.Author: John Belmonte
Reviews.Content: TV looks good and we're happy with the picture.  It doesn't seem that the item is manufactured any longer but perhaps you're considering a used item.  It's an off-brand, and I wouldn't expect long term support, but for the right price (< $400?) this TV is a good value.Yes this TV has lots of input and output compared to the current crop of models (perhaps it's an older model from another manufacturer that's been repackaged?).  One thing lacking though is that the HDMI ports can't wake up the TV from standby (e.g. which devices like Chromecast can take advantage of so you don't need the TV remote to start watching).As many have reported, the remote needs to be aimed directly at the receiver, like within a few degrees. To fix this, simply pop the plastic over off the top of the remote.  Now I can point the remote in any direction and it works 100%.  My conclusion is that the cover wasn't manufactured correctly and is filtering the infrared signal.The panel power button on my unit doesn't seem to work, so we can only power on/off from the remote.

Reviews.Title: Great LED TV for the Money

Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price.  Good clarity and color for a $300 TV. ( got it on sale).  Easy to set up.  Pretty much plug and play wiht my existing Cable service

Reviews.Title: oCOSMO 47-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED MHL & Roku Ready HDTV (Glossy Black)
Reviews.Author: Thomas Holmes

Reviews.Title: This was a smoking deal

Reviews.Title: Very Happy With The Ocosmo TV

Reviews.Content: Good tv for the buck!!!  picture is very good, sound is good, I've seen other tv's which cost $100.00 or more that don't have a better picture. This tv was well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: great affordable tv

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the money.
Reviews.Author: J. E. Batt
Reviews.Content: TV performance better than expected for the price. The TV is used in guest house and not used much. I would purchase another if needed for replacement.

Reviews.Title: great tv for a great price!
Reviews.Author: Sandi Durbin "bloomin crazy"

Reviews.Title: really a great deal for the size and the quality
Reviews.Author: Baraa Felemban

Reviews.Title: Oh Wow oCosmo!
