Reviews.Title: Seek quality elsewhere and you shall be pleased
Reviews.Author: basharx "basharx"
Reviews.Content: I was one of the first to buy this at 329 without any reviews... Good picture, remote is a joke, horrible sound like other buyers found out. The picture is really good for digital but awful for standard definition. There is light bleeding on right side mostly which is very evident against a black screen (such as on an HDMI input with the connected device off). I turned off the automated features like some reviewer recommended, but I wish someone who knows this stuff better would post numbers for "best picture settings."The sound is horrible which automatically forces the user to attach an external audio set, except my soundbar uses an Optical In, and this TV has no Optical, Coax only. The TV's digital output over Coax only outputs the Antenna Tuner in bitstream 5.1 format, everything else connected to the TV then out via SPIDF is PCM.. So I have an older Bose sound system with Coax that I used with this TV and it works fine, so at least I verified that the sound being bad is caused by bad TV speakers and not bad components or circuitry within the TV..When the Apple TV 3rd Gen connects to TV via HDMI, then out to Bose over the Coax from TV its sound is good bu not great, but when I output Apple TV's HDMI video to TV and Apple's Optical Out to the Bose Optical In it sounds really good and looks perfect. (EDIT: I had thought this was due to not routing the sound through the TV and down mixing to Stereo PCM, but I was told in the comments that PCM is not stereo, so i stand corrected). As far as I know, HDTV Cable audio is the only thing that will go over the oCOSMO Coax Out in bitstream 5.1 and it sounds really good out of the Bose speakers (I have no cable box attached, straight cable into TV tuner).The remote is garbage, so you need to spend another 25 for a universal remote (I have this amazing WR7 Universal Remote but it had a hell of time learning the codes for this remote.. Maybe you just need a real Sony remote).. The oCOSMO remote is so bad that even Apple TV 3rd Gen which is extremely forgiving and is willing to learn any remote, can hardly be controlled by the oCOSMO remote.. But this is not a surprise since the TV itself can hardly be controlled by its own remote. I have verified my Sony remote controls it fine (except for input where the TV expects you to press input then arrows to navigate to input, instead of pressing input multiple times to navigate to your input which is what the remote is designed to do).The TV remote's design is a feat of engineering madness in a bad way. It feels like very cheap lump of plastic and has little logic or comfort, and it is so thin it flexes (and that's not a feature)!.. Its back cover keeps falling off to flash the owner with its "Super Lusty" batteries (I kid you not, that's their brand)!All to say by the time you get comfortable with this TV you'd have spent at least 400 (I also bought the 5 year warranty for another 30).. So my recommendation is not to buy it even at 330.. Did I mention how horrible and basic the menus are? Also, if you look at the support website there are no firmware updates and I doubt there will ever be any. Oh, and the shipping box was badly damaged but I don't think anything was broken.The set works for me because I had lots of spare components I can reuse with it and they all work really well to make the set shine, but out of the box it really leaves a lot to be desired.UPDATE WITH RELEVANT NOTES ON SOUND FROM MANUAL:SPDIF - This connection port is used for sending out digital audio signals to digital surround sound receivers. The orange (COAX SPDIF OUT) connector sends out either bit-stream or PCM digital sound signal to a home theater receiver with digital coax input.If you want pure digital stream for your receiver to decode, you must also configure the TV's OSD Sound->Digital Audio Out function. Make sure the option is on 5.1CH.The TV's SPDIF out for 5.1CH is ONLY used for antenna/cable connection. Any other incoming audio signal will be passed out of SPDIF in PCM formatIf your receiver is making static noises when receiving 5.1CH, you must use the PCM option instead.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly AMAZING. Clear picture, great Buy.
Reviews.Author: R. Rea
Reviews.Content: After initially purchasing a SEIKI 47" for around the same price (Which arrived with Dead pixels), I was hesitant to pick up a brand that I didn't recognize. This TV is AMAZING, we replaced our 32" Samsung in the living room with this, and absolutely adore it. I had to go and buy more blu-ray movies just to test this thing out fully.Pro:Great picture, very large number of inputs/outputs.Headphone Jack + Audio Input and PC Input (VGA) works great for Media Center and if you don't have a sound bar.I just use Computer speakers and it works perfectly fine.Con:For some WEIRD reason, they put a packaging sticker (Great picture/Contrast ratio, all that junk) directly ON the screen in the corner. It was stuck on pretty good and I was afraid of damaging the screen, luckily my girlfriend has fingernails that could curl an edge to peel it off. Thankfully it did come off cleanly, but definitely recommend you be CAREFUL.Overall fantastic buy, we've had it for a few weeks now and I honestly feel like I won't be needing a new tv for a decade at least.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed with the sound
Reviews.Author: Debra Mariano
Reviews.Content: The sound is not great I have to put it on full volume to hear it.  I'm going to buy a sound bar.

Reviews.Title: Great bargain on a fantastic HDTV
Reviews.Author: T. McKamy
Reviews.Content: I have had the TV for a couple of weeks now, and I am more impressed every day.  Using as main entertainment tv with HD antenna source.  Some channels are a bit grainy at times, but others are stunningly crisp (depends on signal strength).  Everything is completely watchable,just being precise.  DVD's played through HDMI XBOX 360 are sharp and clear.  Running sound through a vizio sound bar.  Love the thin profile,slick black bezel and simple controls.  Remote is junk, but I've been using a programmable remote for 10 years now so its just a dust collector anyway.  Was concerned about 60 hz refresh since my Vizio 37" has 120, but so far it has been a non-factor and i have been putting it through its paces with a lot of big action movies

Reviews.Title: Really impressed!
Reviews.Author: Mandypandy
Reviews.Content: I bought a 39' flat screen tv on black Friday off walmart.com to begin with. I got it and the picture quality was TERRIBLE. So I sent it back and spent a little more money on this tv. Wow what a difference! I only paid about $70 more on this tv and it is a million times better. Everyone complains about the sound, but I think it's fine. If you are looking for a movie theater type sound system this is not it but why would you expect that when you are not paying for it? Love this tv. It seems like it is built really well. I would recommend it for sure. Only had it for a few days but if anything changes I will change my review!

Reviews.Title: Bargain!
Reviews.Author: Shane Walker
Reviews.Content: Picture is great, sound quality so-so but I knew that when I bought and the price was great.  Bought another one after getting this one.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Phong Ho
Reviews.Content: So far so good, you really can't beat this TV for the price. Not sure what more I can say other than do like I did and buy the warranty just in case. It's an off brand TV, what more can you really expect?

Reviews.Title: This was a great value and really good quality.
Reviews.Author: Joseph Baker
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this television.It was very well packaged, and has flawless picture quality.It has enough HDMI ports(3), as well as old school composite, component, and 15-pin d-sub.

Reviews.Title: oCOSMO impressed me!
Reviews.Author: P. Lama "Buddha_Mind"
Reviews.Content: Cons not found yet! Although, it is not a con but Roku ready kind of deceiving just because any HDMI ready TVs are Roku ready, don't you think or am I not understanding what Roku ready meant. I have roku so I wanted to see, what that meant. I am like Haha! WOW why do you need to put that there in bold letters, may be for marketing. I get it. But yes, you can hook up Roku.Pros: Oh boy, its big for the bucks. Well made, 3 hdmi inputs, usb for media but it said only supports 2gb so I couldn't really use my 1 tb hard drive. the biggest plus is headphone jack audio ready. I have these computer speakers and I plugged it in, oh my the difference in sound is amazing. Crystal clear images. Well packaged, comes with even screw driver if you don't have it. Amazon fast delivery. I ordered on Saturday, I got it on Wed. I hooked up my Xbox and its amazing. I thought of getting 40 inch but I am glad I went for this one. Oh also remote control has a set of buttons for oCOSMO sound bar, in case one feels to have a bigger sound, I know I don't  need it but just a thought. Very easy to navigate. I didn't really play with the quality of the picture setting as factory setting is universal. Sometime, if you play around a lot can mess something up and cannot bring to the right lighting or brightness. I also plugged in my android TV via HDMI input, everything works via WIFI of course. I watch Netflix boy, its almost blue-ray. This is by far one of the superior product I have bought. It can easily compete with named brands. It is LED TV & energy star. Oh also on & off buttons are on the bottom part of the TV so if u were to carry on the side, no worries of pressing, no big deal of course. Happy buying & watching later!

Reviews.Title: Great picture.
Reviews.Author: Matthew Wallace
Reviews.Content: I've only had this set for a few days now but the picture is outstanding. I've got it hooked up through a surround sound so I can't attest to the sets sound quality. Other reviews say it's not great, which is why I got the surround sound. I would definatly recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: oCOSMO 47-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED MHL & Roku Ready HDTV (Glossy Black)
Reviews.Author: Jenny Weber
Reviews.Content: This is one of the few times I've given a review, but I thought I needed to help out the next person not sure of buying this TV.  I actually bought two of these, one for my folks for Christmas and one for my family.  The picture quality is outstanding!  Really I cannot state how clear the picture is.  I'm not a TV buff just someone who has watched TV all my life!  Although the picture, color quality is fantastic, the sound is really tinnie.  I know others have bought something to take care of this problem but I have not as of yet.  I only paid $339. for these so the fact that the sound is tinnie is livable for me for now.  Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Vizio Prodigy
Reviews.Author: Nicole talercio
Reviews.Content: This TV is crystal clear, so many ports, hooked it up to Chromecast.  Adjust audio and settings and BAM!  I am impressed for $329.  I would have easily spent $500 on this.  Great brand so far.  This company has to be taking a hit to get their name out.. It's awesome. All my friends and family won't get out of my room.  It's worth the money and the risk. This company makes great products and this is only the beginning!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Steve Harper
Reviews.Content: Exceptional value, Couldn't ask  for more from a TV for the price I paid for it.I got the $329.00 price and had a $75.00 gift card laying around for a couple of months and used it, so my net cost was $254.00. WOW, for a 47" LED TV!!!I certainly had my reservations, but in reading the reviews here, I thought why not take a chance.It arrived secure and well packaged the with no damage.Took it out of the box, attached a very sturdy tempered glass base, plugged in all my cables, etc and turned it on. Worked perfectly from the start with very little adjustments for color, sharpness, contrast etc.The picture is fantastic and clear. As far as the sound goes, I didn't even bother to attempt to listen to the TV speakers, and immediately hooked up my sound bar and the sound is fantastic as well.

Reviews.Title: Still overall like it for the price and picture
Reviews.Author: chris berarducci
Reviews.Content: It's advertised as ROKU ready, I ordered the ROKU streaming stick at the same time.  The ROKU streaming stick does not fit into the TV because the TV bezel is not deep enough.Working on a workaournd with a short HDMI cable from the TV to the ROKU but that has not come yet.Still overall like it for the price and picture:)

Reviews.Title: Almost the perfect purchase.
Reviews.Author: NNAMDI AZIDE "CHAMBER 42"
Reviews.Content: This would hands-down be a 5-star review had it not been for the nightmare delivery fiasco that ended with me going to pick up the massive thing myself from a UPS warehouse...Aside from that, all I can say it WOW. The out of the box picture is nowhere near optimal but after tinkering with the settings and some trial and error, I now have a picture that beats out my neighbors 55' Samsung LCD television that he paid over $900 for. I got this gem of a television at the $329 price and again, once you adjust the settings it will look like a much more expensive set.Pros:Great picture (with correct settings)Fancy looking remoteSwivel baseSuperbright screenCons:Menus are very basicRemote must be aimed directly at sensor to workWeird rear bezel makes it difficult to access HDMI plugins****a few people mentioned "poor sound quality", I don't agree with this because it sounds like a TV to me. If you want the sound to surround you, buy surround sound.

Reviews.Title: Sizes in product details incorrect
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Price makes this an excellent value. At $329 after black Friday we couldn't pass it up when the smart TV we were looking at sold out right before ordering. I wasn't thrilled with size for price of a smart anyway and had been arguing with boyfriend about smart/not. As you see I won:) So a Roku is next on list & Ta-da!! We both get what we want. There was maybe one review when ordered so went simply by price and size.Major discrepancy on the posted details for this 47" is the actual dimensions posted on product details.Claimed size:  47.6 x 6.5 x 34.1Real size:  44 2 x 4.4 x 27, these are without base.Base size:  10.2 x 19.6The base itself is impressive. Tempered class with a slight bevel on edges. It is about 1/4 inch thick mostly black except about a 1/4 inch around edge that is clear. I like this much better that even the known name brand cheap plastic bases, is flat and uses 5 screws to attach to TV. Very solid.So here are my Pros:Excellent base.Swivel feature is great!Picture is great.So far remote is working.Cons:SoundAs others have said the sound is not great. And that's saying a lot considering I gave my parents my previous flat screen a year ago and have been watching dvds on a 15.6 inch lap top with only built in speakers for the last year. Going to invest in some speakers which I would want to do regardless. This would be 5 star if sound was better.The price I purchased this TV for is well worth it. Name brands mean nothing to me other than there are more reviews and expectations. If you want to show off your new TV this isn't the one for you. I do think this brand would be a good buy for kids/guest room. And just for more info this TV is only hooked to a converter with antenna until this weekend when we get dvd player and is working wonderfully.12/15/2013 UPDATE: sound has gotten worse, even with constant tweaking. Goes up and down in volume as well as cutting out periodically for a few seconds. We've gotten a blu-ray player and the controlled input with quality hdmi connect makes no difference. Also a mark/dead pixels appeared on screen near middle. As a photographer the visual effect of mark bothers me more than the sound does:/ We may decide to go thru return process but not until after holidays.

Reviews.Title: One week, no problems, lots of smiles!
Reviews.Author: Nada Chance "Nada Chance"
Reviews.Content: We waited a week to write our review, just in case it burned out or began having problems.There are none.It has a nice crisp picture, the sound quality is fine although we did hook it up to a sound system...which made the quality great. It gets EXCELLENT reception; our Sony received half the channels this one does, and was always dropping them. We've got a computer, DVD player, and PS2 hooked up as well with no problems at all.It's a good television. We can't pick any flaws with it. Even the base is of good thick tempered glass with a solid, thick metal connecting piece and five screws to hold it.  If we'd spent a thousand dollars we'd demand better sound, but, really, this is a very nice television and it's worked perfectly for us all week! With the 5-year guarantee, we're very happy.

Reviews.Title: order one if you wanna win
Reviews.Author: trent
Reviews.Content: great tv at a great price. buy! buy! buy! The picture is great quality and the sound is very amazing.

Reviews.Title: Good TV Bad Speakers
Reviews.Author: disco
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm rating this a three star is because the speakers for this TV is of very low quality. I'm not trying to get a deep bass sound because the treble seems a little too high. I'm not trying to break windows just a balanced sound. Turning the bass and volume up causes a cracking sound of the speakers as if the speaker cones are blown. If your going to watch a movie and volume needs to be high for the theater effect I would recommend that you invest in a sound bar or a surround system. For daily use it works fine for me. For the price I paid for I cannot complain  too much. I would recommend that you might as well buy the sound bar with the TV.  I'm waiting for ocosmo to come out with bigger screens. If they come out with a 55 inch I would replace this 47 inch.

Reviews.Title: Great for the cost.
Reviews.Author: Michelle Kosinski
Reviews.Content: Exceeded my expectations.  Great deal. Bought this for my mother.  Picture is great. Sound is good. Arrived next day via UPS.

Reviews.Title: Not your typical off-brand TV.
Reviews.Author: T. L. Driggers "toddler sponge bob fan"
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to buy an off-brand after a poor Walmart experience.  But after reading the reviews, I thought I'd give it another try because it was discounted.  We received this TV within days.  It looks great and sounds fantastic.  I bought it for my son's video game area, but I would not hesitate to use as our main TV.  The remote is very similar to other TV's as far as difficulty is concerned.  With all the features, it's not going to be cake to work.  I read some reviews that said that the remote is cheaply made, but it is nicer than the Walmart TV remote we got.  I do like that you can control your soundbar with the remote (although we don't feel like we need one) and that the remote is set up like most other name brand remotes.  I will update this if I have any problems.  It's a great buy for under $400.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected
Reviews.Author: Ralph
Reviews.Content: Got it, hooked it up,,,,love it!. Great picture, sound is no worse than the LG that it replaced. Glad I got one of the last ones for $329 because the price just went up ...

Reviews.Title: No brainer.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Princess
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable.  330 bucks, 47" slim-as-hell LED.  Picture is great.  3 hdmi inputs.  What else do you need?Yes, the sound is bad.  I'll have to spring for a sound bar.Yes, the remote control is dinky.  But, ummmm, who cares?Yes, there are no apps.  But, ummmm, who cares?

Reviews.Title: Exceptional value.  Beautiful TV.
Reviews.Author: FroRule
Reviews.Content: TV arrived a few days ago.  With temps in the 20's outside, I let it warm up a few hours before firing it up.  Initial impressions are very good.  I used the settings that someone else here posted from their THX app except I turned brightness down to 35.  Sound isn't too bad -I would give that 3 stars, but the picture and the exceptional value of the TV bring the overall rating up to 5 stars.Everything works as it should.  No dead pixels.  Beautiful picture!  So far so good!  I will post any updates should the TV start to act up.The remote is fine, although it seemed you had to stand fairly close to the TV.  I am a Tivo owner and I had a little trouble finding the proper remote code b/c oCosmo is not a listed brand.  It took a few minutes, but the thankfully the remote eventually found the proper code using the 0999 code/channel up technique (google it).  I'm a happy camper!!I would not hesitate to purchase this TV again or recommend it to family/friends.

Reviews.Title: Awsome TV
Reviews.Author: Dung Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Just want to say, WOW, this TV is great, i expected the quality to be ok with the pricing, but i was wrong. The sound and tv quality is excellent. Ordered 1 more for my family as well.

Reviews.Title: Crisp, clear and a bonus, it is swively.
Reviews.Author: Mike Ziskovsky
Reviews.Content: Great sound and quality. It stands great on it is own, it is also surprisingly light. Great balance and features.

Reviews.Title: Good picture quality
Reviews.Author: yadab chandra das
Reviews.Content: so far so good. it has 3 hdmi ports and picture quality is good. But sound is ok, I do care. I never liked any tv sounds because I have Bose sound system :-)

Reviews.Title: Sound quality sucks!!  Picture not much better....
Reviews.Author: Sunny Side Up
Reviews.Content: The sound on this tv is TERRIBLE the sound fluctuates up and down. The quality sounds like the waves are moving through a tin can. This is a common reviewer complaint. I made the purchase anyway with the thought that everyone has different hearing comforts.This product would probably be okay as others have done...connecting to external sound source. I'm not going to purchase additional products to hear my tv.I am going to return this product and put the extra money into a smaller television...but a higher quality product.Picture quality...ok when hooked to hd antenna. Stations that don't broadcast in full 1080hd....my personal opinion, the picture sucks as well.I had previously ordered the seiki 46" that tv was great all the way around however, there was a pixel distortion that was on the left lower side of screen. I would have replaced that tv but it is out of stock through Amazon.....boo hoo!Amazon on the other hand is great as far as returns and customer relations. Kudos to Amazon!Don't waste you time or. Excitement on this television.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the old price
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: My friend bought this Looks and sound good. However it is only woth the 329 dollar price. They now raised the price and if you can afford the 479 dollar price you can afford much nicer sets at 500 dollars. The other big store that has initials W M still has a comparable SEIKI 47 inch  set for 329.00 so hurry on over

Reviews.Title: Fine for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Montgomery
Reviews.Content: Really more like 3 1/2 stars.  I haven't hooked up too much to it yet, just a wii and an upconverting dvd player so I haven't hooked up anything HD.  Picture so far is ok and the sound is ok at best.  There is some light bleeding and the remote is horrible, but this is for the kids playroom and is replacing a 51 inch rear projection tv, so the picture is still a big improvement over what it replaced.  The remote is very cheaply made and labeling was an afterthought.  Kinda difficult to find what you are looking for.Oh, and whoever can do something about this on Amazons side....how about NOT putting a STICKER on the screen.  I can still see where the sticker was after removing it.  Matter o' fact, I am taking back that 1/2 star from the beginning just for that.I thought it was packaged very well.Assuming it lasts, this will be sufficient for its purpose.  I wouldn't want this as my main tv, but considering the price I shouldn't expect too much anyway.  330 for a 47inch LED....c'mon.

Reviews.Title: sure is big
Reviews.Author: R. Serna "xdiyguy"
Reviews.Content: Sure is big was my son's first reaction to me. All the kids liked it so we are happy. hope it works out.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat this deal!
Reviews.Author: Martian3438
Reviews.Content: I bought it because of the price but was pleasantly surprised by the quality.  This has to be the best deal for a big screen LED HDTV right now.

Reviews.Title: Got a lemon, bottom bezel, buttons cracked from factory, and software error. Hope new one will work.
Reviews.Author: Abdool
Reviews.Content: I received my order today and I was excited to open the box.  Upon opening the box, I noticed the bottom left where the buttons are supposed to be was cracked.  All of the buttons fell off and some into the tv.  The second problem I encountered was that the bottom bezel was cracked completely.  In high spirits, I decided to plug it in to see if it worked.  It booted up with the initial setup menu.  I kept clicking enter to move onto another menu but it was stuck on initial setup.  It would not work, it kept flipping between languages.  The remote or software programming must have been defective.  I was really hoping to get the tv working but, I ended up having to request an exchange with Amazon.  I am returning this defective model received for another one that is fully functional.My first impressions:The screen size is great for the prize and it is thinSome sort of error in the software did not allow moving beyond initial setupNext, I hope to receive my new set in a few days so I can post an updated review.  Right now I am disappointed that I got a lemon but, hopeful the next one will be working just fine.

Reviews.Title: At least Amazon customer service worked well
Reviews.Author: flstc7
Reviews.Content: Ordered this as a Black Friday deal. Guaranteed 2 day delivery, great price, 47 inch led Roku ready tv, what a great deal! Not so much.First, delivery was a fiasco. The set did not show up when it was supposed to. Customer service said it was lost somewhere in the shipping process. The rep ordered a second set as a replacement. Two days later the ordinal set showed up. Two days after that, the second tv showed up. Though it was a pain, the duplication was resolved fairly quickly by customer service.Second, I was amazed at how poorly the tv was packaged. The set showed up on the door step in the retail box only. Very little protection for a electronic device of this size. The container had definitely seen better days.When the tv was finally opened by the gift recipient on Christmas, she found that the stand was scratched up, the frame was cracked through its width, and that two of the function buttons had fallen off (most likely due to the frame damage).This was a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: dnastar
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review just after placing my order of this item. I know I probably should post the *review* after actually receive the item, but I think sharing my information might do some help to people who are wondering the same questions as me these days.I think some people first time see this TV and this brand may have the same questions as me: what is this brand? why it is so cheap? How about the build quality of this TV?I did some research online, and found something interesting about this TV. However I will not directly tell my opinion about what it is, since it is up to the reader to believe or not. I think the best way is to give the keyword and the readers can do the search by themselves, and make their own buying decision provided the information they found.The keyword is E475BV-FMDU. I think it is not hard to find out another TV given this model number. Check the product gallery, and notice the picture of its back. There is no picture of the back of this oCosmo TV here, but should be easy to find it in the oCosmo official site. Now compare the two and I found they look almost the same.For the other 2 oCosmo TVs on sale, it shouldn't be hard to find their "sister" products by looking into that official site of *the* 3rd party brand. So I believe this TV is a re-brand or at least manufactured by *the* 3rd party brand we just found. About the quality of the products from *the* manufacturer, I believe there are a lot reviews on the internet. At least to me, I think it is of reasonable quality.I am looking for a TV which is "not expensive" enough so I do not need to worry about its protection, but should have reasonable build/video quality. I do not really care about the sound quality since it is easy to use an external speaker. I also purchased the insurance so I don't really worry about how long will it last - the insurance vendor seems pretty new in this field but I know them from another insurance I purchased.Also I noticed this TV is sold by Amazon, which I think is another layer of "protection" because of the best customer support. Based on all these info I finally made my decision to give it a try.If I get a chance I'll update my review once I receive the item. I ordered a chromecast stick too so hopefully I can enjoy youtube on my new TV in a few days!********* 12/6 update *****************some explanation:1. Initially I gave the product 3 star rating since I think I should give some neutral rating before I actually receive it. However I changed my mind, maybe I should give it 4 stars since I would recommend to buy it even I have not received it yet. I will rate a final score once I get the set and try it out.2. Maybe I am not clear about the keyword, search E475BV-FMDU on google. The page I mentioned should appear at 2nd or 3rd entry in the results.3. I posted this early review just want to share my findings and I think it might do some help. I don't want to confuse people. Since I see most of the readers do not find it useful... If you are the reader and you don't think it is helping you, could you please add comments let me know why my review does not do any help? I'll be glad to help, or delete this review if most people think it is not necessary.********* 12/14 update *****************received the TV set on Tuesday. Connected to my desktop via HDMI, also plugged chromecast. after a few days use, i think i should give it 4.5-star by its own quality, but given its price, i do think it should get a 5-star.1. the overall build quality is good.2. this TV set is huge but not too heavy.3. the video quality is nice, but the default setting is not optimal. you may need to do some tweak to achieve best view. the following ratings are based on 5 as best quality:  * sharpness: 4.5  * color: 4  * smooth: 4.54. actually the sound quality is not bad.5. the base allows to swivel which is convenientsome small issues:1. have to point the remote directly to the lower left corner of the TV to operate2. power cord is not detachable3. a bit hard to plug HDMI cable since the space is a bit narrow. I could not plug the chromecast stick directly to the TV, have to use the extension cable4. the packaging says: "save all original packaging materials. warranty void if transported in other than original packaging"5. can not find its manual pdf download on ocosmo official websiteoverall, this is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: TV broke within 30 days
Reviews.Author: Tara Reyna
Reviews.Content: I only had the TV for 30 days before it broke and I had to return it.  Definitely wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Sound is atrocious
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: This sounded like a great deal but once it arrived my wife and I promptly hooked it up and the sound was really bad.  I am not one of those sound system snobs that needs the sound to be perfect, what I mean is the sound on every channel had a staticky kind of noise when the volume was at normal listening levels (maybe the speakers were already blown). This set is going back ASAP!  Before buying this set, I did notice that there weren't any reviews for this tv but the other ocosmo speakers were rated very poorly.  Just avoid this if possible, the price is not worth listening to static.
